content: 1 loop slip_stitch connector insert hook in tch bump insert hook in blo of next stitch below yo and pull thru everything fig 2 pattern notes hat is worked side to side and seamed with slip_stitch crochet the crown is sewn closed with the long tail after seaming crown shaping is done in short row a ribbed hatband is built in to the body stitch pattern to adjust hat height add or subtract foundation chains in pairs for the hatband ribbing in any amount for the body hat circumference is determined by how many wedges you crochet all stitches are worked in blo unless directed otherwise the last stitch of the row can hide so consider placing a marker in the flo of the first stitch of the row as you begin a new row when you turn the marker will show you exactly where that elusive last stitch is hiding always turn clockwise turning chains tch at the crown and hatband row ends are snugged down all other tch at short row ends are not snugged down as they will be worked into later ideas for pattern customization if you prefer a single layer beanie style hat calculate your stitch gauge and figure out your foundation chain length based on your desired hat height add or delete stitches in the faux mistake rib section in pairs in any amount for the body section this sample crocheted in bulky weight self-striping yarn is worked mostly in faux mistake rib 22 sts using the single_crochet ribbing 8 sts only for crown shaping it s good looking either as a single layer beanie or in the turned up watchcap style if you don t want a shaped crown you can work this pattern without short row as a simple rectangle and finish the crown in whatever manner you prefer for a snugger bottom edge on the hatband in addition to the snug chain 1 for the turning chain called for in the pattern you can also snug down the last half_double_crochet on the ws row before working the snug chain 1 or you can work that last half_double_crochet twisted with yarn held in back as we normally do insert the hook back to front in the blo of the last stitch then yo and complete the half_double_crochet as normal faux mistake rib touque © 2022 ~ aunt zany ~ 7/18/2022 ~ page 2 of 7 hat pattern first wedge foundation chain 52 or whatever stitch count you need for your gauge and hat size chain 1 snug for tch does not count as a stitch here and throughout turn clockwise row 1 ws work all sts in blo unless instructed otherwise slip_stitch in first 5 sts pm in flo of first st single_crochet in next 29 sts pm in flo of last single_crochet slip_stitch half_double_crochet 9 times snug chain 1 turn 52 row 2 rs slip_stitch half_double_crochet until first marker single_crochet until 5 sts rem move up marker slip_stitch in next 3
